nodes.name: ReadCSV
nodes.description: It reads in CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it
nodes.details: This node reads CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it.
nodes.hint: Whenever the file is changed, Refresh the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Path of the Text file/directory

fields.name: separator
fields.title: Separator
fields.description: CSV Separator

fields.name: header
fields.title: Header
fields.description: Does the file have a header row

fields.name: dropSpecialCharacterInColumnName
fields.title: Drop Special Character In ColumnName
fields.description: Drop the SpecialCharacter and Space in Column Name.

fields.name: dropMalformed
fields.title: Drop Malformed
fields.description: Whether to drop Malformed records or error

fields.name: outputColNames
fields.title: Column Names for the CSV
fields.description: New Output Columns of the SQL

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Column Types for the CSV
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColFormats
fields.title: Column Formats for the CSV
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: y
fields.title: Y
fields.description: The time-series to which to fit the ARIMA estimator

fields.name: start_p
fields.title: start_p
fields.description: The starting value of p, the order (or number of time lags) of the auto-regressive (“AR”) model. Must be a positive integer.

fields.name: d
fields.title: d
fields.description: The order of first-differencing. If None (by default), the value will automatically be selected based on the results of the test.

fields.name: start_q
fields.title: start_q
fields.description: The starting value of q, the order of the moving-average (“MA”) model. Must be a positive integer.

fields.name: max_p
fields.title: max_p
fields.description: The maximum value of p, inclusive. Must be a positive integer greater than or equal to start_p.

fields.name: max_d
fields.title: max_d
fields.description: The maximum value of d, or the maximum number of non-seasonal differences. Must be a positive integer greater than or equal to d.

fields.name: max_q
fields.title: max_q
fields.description: The maximum value of q, inclusive. Must be a positive integer greater than start_q.

fields.name: start_P
fields.title: start_P
fields.description: The starting value of P, the order of the auto-regressive portion of the seasonal model.

fields.name: D
fields.title: D
fields.description: The order of the seasonal differencing. If None (by default, the value will automatically be selected based on the results of the seasonal_test. Must be a positive integer or None.

fields.name: start_Q
fields.title: start_Q
fields.description: The starting value of Q, the order of the moving-average portion of the seasonal model.

fields.name: max_P
fields.title: max_P
fields.description: The maximum value of P, inclusive. Must be a positive integer greater than start_P.

fields.name: max_D
fields.title: max_D
fields.description: The maximum value of D. Must be a positive integer greater than D.

fields.name: max_Q
fields.title: max_Q
fields.description: The maximum value of Q, inclusive. Must be a positive integer greater than start_Q.

fields.name: max_order
fields.title: max_order
fields.description: If the sum of p and q is >= max_order, a model will not be fit with those parameters, but will progress to the next combination. Default is 5. If max_order is None, it means there are no constraints on maximum order.

fields.name: m
fields.title: m
fields.description: The period for seasonal differencing, m refers to the number of periods in each season.

fields.name: information_criterion
fields.title: Information Criterion
fields.description: The information criterion used to select the best ARIMA model.

fields.name: stationary
fields.title: stationary
fields.description: Whether the time-series is stationary and d should be set to zero.

fields.name: seasonal
fields.title: Seasonal
fields.description: Whether to fit a seasonal ARIMA. Default is True

fields.name: stepwise
fields.title: Stepwise
fields.description: Whether to use the stepwise algorithm to identify the optimal model parameters.

fields.name: trace
fields.title: Trace
fields.description: Whether to print status on the fits.

fields.name: suppress_warnings
fields.title: Suppress Warnings
fields.description: If suppress_warnings is True, all of the warnings coming from ARIMA will be squelched.

fields.name: error_action
fields.title: Error Action
fields.description: If unable to fit an ARIMA for whatever reason, this controls the error-handling behavior. One of (warn, raise, ignore)

fields.name: scoring
fields.title: Scoring
fields.description: The metric to use for scoring the out-of-sample data. One of (mse, mae)

fields.name: n_periods
fields.title: Forecast
fields.description: Int number of periods to forecast forward.

nodes.name: PrintNRows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output
nodes.details:
This node is used to print incoming dataset.

Number of rows that needs to be printed can be configured in the node.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: n
fields.title: Num Rows to Print
fields.description: number of rows to be printed

fields.name: displayDataType
fields.title: Display Data Type
fields.description: If true display rows DataType

nodes.name: ZipWithIndex
nodes.description: This node Generates a new column with unique Index/Value for each row in the Dataset
nodes.details:
This node Generates a new column with unique Index/Value for each row in the Dataset.

This column is added to the outgoing Dataframe. It can be used to access a row within the Dataframe.
nodes.examples:
Incoming Dataframe has following rows:

CUST_CD | CUST_NAME | AGE | DATE_OF_JOINING | SALARY
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
C01 | MATT | 50 | 12-02-2002 | USD 200000.00
C02 | LISA | 45 | 15-11-2020 | GBP 100000.00
C03 | ROBIN | 30 | 10-10-2015 | EUR 15000.00
C04 | MARCUS | 35 | 01-01-2021 | AUD 350000.00

If ZipWithIndex node is configured to create an index column as [INDEX_COL]
then outgoing Dataframe would be created as below containing the index column:

CUST_CD | CUST_NAME | AGE | DATE_OF_JOINING | SALARY | INDEX_COL
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
C01 | MATT | 50 | 12-02-2002 | USD 200000.00 | 0
C02 | LISA | 45 | 15-11-2020 | GBP 100000.00 | 1
C03 | ROBIN | 30 | 10-10-2015 | EUR 15000.00 | 2
C04 | MARCUS | 35 | 01-01-2021 | AUD 350000.00 | 3

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: indexColName
fields.title: Index Column Name
fields.description: Index column name

fields.title: Bg Color
fields.description: Background of note

fields.name: width
fields.title: Width
fields.description: Width of note

fields.name: height
fields.title: Height
fields.description: Height of note

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
Air Passengers Forecasting


Time Series is a series of observations taken at specified time intervals, usually equal intervals. Analysis of the series helps us to predict future values based on previous observed values. In the Time series, we have only 2 variables, time & the variable we want to forecast. ARIMA will predict future demand of air passengers which helps Airline companies to make decisions on aircraft fleet management.
fields.title: Comment
fields.description: Comments for the Workflow

fields.name: comment
fields.value: ARIMA(Auto Regressive Integrated Moving Average) is a combination of 2 models AR(Auto Regressive) & MA(Moving Average). It has 3 hyperparameters - P(auto regressive (order of differentiation),Q(moving avg.) which respectively comes from the AR, I & MA components.
